us.phonetic: /adj. kəmˈpækt, ˈkɑmpækt; v. kəmˈpækt; n. ˈkɑmpækt/, (adj. kəm pakt′, kom-, kom′pakt; v. kəm pakt′; n. kom′pakt)

example.eg: Compact cars often don't have much leg room.
He has a very compact build but he's fast.
If the soil's too compact, add some organic material.
The fabric can be compacted for easy shipping.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…压实, 把…紧紧打包在一起

example.eg: Ellen suddenly realized she'd left her compact on the train.

us.phonetic: /adj. kəmˈpækt, ˈkɑmpækt; v. kəmˈpækt; n. ˈkɑmpækt/, (adj. kəm pakt′, kom-, kom′pakt; v. kəm pakt′; n. kom′pakt)

example.eg: The two nations signed a compact agreeing to end the trade war.

us.phonetic: /adj. kəmˈpækt, ˈkɑmpækt; v. kəmˈpækt; n. ˈkɑmpækt/, (adj. kəm pakt′, kom-, kom′pakt; v. kəm pakt′; n. kom′pakt)

example.eg: The company launched a new model of the compact car about a month ago.
I keep my compact discs on a shelf in the corner.
